Yesterday, we announced a new visual experience for Dharma Lever

1095764247479386112.text: 14/ Our goal with Lever is to make borrowing and lending beautiful and easily accessible — we're here to onboard the next million users to crypto finance. If you'd like to experience the magic for yourself, sign up for our alpha partner waitlist: https://bit.ly/2S0AQ39

1095764245734612994.text: 13/ We also wanted to push the lending experience further. Rather than just sending your money to a contract and waiting to earn interest, we've created a brand new way to manage your loan offer. View the health of your loan and all of your accrued interest in real time!pic.twitter.com/F4C4Bn0cdI

1095764244056788992.text: 12/ Sending your funds to the Dharma Credit Market is as easy as...you guessed it...sending money to a smart contract! Get used to Lever doing a lot of the work for youpic.twitter.com/ciT1g0sW8z

1095764242869846016.text: 11/ On the lend side, putting your capital to work starts with selecting an asset you want to lend, specifying the amount you want to lend, and providing an address where you want to receive repaymentspic.twitter.com/0xCdBq02Kz

1095764241527631872.text:
10/ Let's say your position isn't working out as intended and you need to add collateral to protect your loan from liquidation..looking at you CDP owners

With Lever, adding collateral is as easy to selecting an amount and sending funds to a smart contract, we'll handle the rest!pic.twitter.com/HtO20hjYJU

1095764240156094464.text: 9/  From there, the user just sends money to a smart contract, that's it! the principal will be in their wallet in minutespic.twitter.com/2hz0hqbcwb

1095764238591700992.text: 8/ Borrowing starts with selecting an asset to borrow, specifying an amount to borrow, and providing the address where you want to receive your principalpic.twitter.com/xP23nrHcib

1095764238163832832.text: 7/ At Dharma, we believe in 'show, don't tell,' so let's go through the flow so you can see it for yourself

1095764237601755136.text: 6/ For borrowers, you can access a transparently priced pool of credit liquidity and borrow crypto with near instant settlement. No more day long settlement times and exorbitant interest rates

1095764237031329792.text: 5/ Our goal with this new design is to make the crypto finance experience dynamic rather than static. Instead of simply buying crypto assets and forgetting about them, why not put them to work in a globally accessible credit market?

1095764236481875968.text: 4/ Similarly, Lever works a lot like today's most popular fin-tech products: send money here and we'll take care of everything for you. We think this is the best way to bring smart contracts to the masses, we have to make accessing them as simple as possible

1095764235819216896.text: 3/ This means making a product that users are familiar with, one that fits into their existing patterns and doesn't force them to learn a ton of new behaviors. For example, users can access Lever from any wallet they control, no chrome extensions or special browsers required

1095764235047456768.text: 2/ With Lever, we want to take the next step in making #DeFi a reality. We want to onboard the next million users to crypto so they can experience the magic and speed of upgraded, programmable finance. Doing so necessitates a UX as accessible as the underlying infrastructure

1095764234514849793.text: 1/ When we set out to build Dharma Lever, we wanted to build a rare product in the crypto space: one that solves actual user problems all with a level of UX we expect from today's best products. Today, we take the next step in our journey: https://bit.ly/2S0AQ39

1092517459234512896.text:
11/ While short selling in traditional markets might seem a bit daunting, it can be done in a few clicks with the help of #DeFi protocols

We've recently opened up our alpha partner waitlist to users who want to borrow ETH at 2% APR, you can sign up at: https://dharmalever.com

1092517273766490112.text: 10/ Repay your loan after the price decline and enjoy your profits!pic.twitter.com/KsRcwnQf7B

1092516920106991616.text:
9/ Send the principal to an exchange of your choosing and sell it for USDC or DAI

Wait for the price to decline...

Buy back the principal

1092516793158066176.text: 8/ Send your collateral to a smart contract and receive your principal in minutes!pic.twitter.com/2znf4UueND

1092516510856138752.text: 7/ Next, specify how much of the asset you want to borrowpic.twitter.com/RIxsQlo13A

1092516390810963968.text: 6/ First, select an asset you want to borrow. If you want to short ETH, you must first borrow ETHpic.twitter.com/mcVMWtBiFe

1092516240445206528.text:
5/ Luckily for the Ethereum ecosystem, a number of #DeFi platforms enable investors to execute short sells today

The most popular trustless lending avenues are @makerDAO, Dharma Lever, @dydxprotcol, and @compoundfinance

Let's walkthrough a short sell through Dharma Lever

1092515893970591746.text: 4/ The most important thing to remember is that In order to sell the asset before you own it, you must *borrow it*

1092515840212197378.text: 3/ Short selling is used by investors as a way of capitalizing on an asset they think is overvalued. Instead of sitting on the sidelines, investors can take advantage of mispricings by selling the underlying asset without owning it, and then buying it back at a lower price

1092515722368958464.text:
2/ Short selling gives market participants a way of expressing a negative view — leading to more liquidity, additional hedging avenues, and most importantly, more efficient price discovery

In particular, short selling plays a crucial role in dampening asset bubbles

1049450390553411584.text: 12/ RegDex is a compliant relayer that uses on-chain KYC via @sendwyre to allow regulated trading of Dharma debt tokens. @AndreiAnisimov_ and team built an awesome platform that leverages a number of foundational financial primitives, nice work!https://bit.ly/2pQ0zjv

1049450283892236288.text: 11/ Robinbot is a white hat protocol that recovers lost crypto assets when developers accidentally push their private keys and mnemonics to public GitHub repos. However, the bot does lend the assets out for a bit to earn some interest  great work!https://bit.ly/2E7w7v6

1049450066291785728.text: 10/ http://lattice.loan  is an application for peer to peer lending in underserved communities. The app creates a universal line of credit for each borrower that’s secured by homomorphic encryption lattices, really awesome work!https://bit.ly/2OKYYcC

1049449960133914624.text: 9/ dAppraise is a protocol built by @radicalcalvin that allows users to post a hybrid of fungible and non-fungible assets as collateral for loans. Allowing users to collateralize loans with real-world assets will open up access to Dharma credit markets:https://bit.ly/2NvMscu

1049449864570892288.text: 8/ cNote is a platform for safely investing in startups through convertible notes/SAFTs built by @lingqingmeng, @jzjzme, and @bwonymph Startups can develop a FICO score and earn funding based on on-chain metrics like active users and daily transactions:https://bit.ly/2pF9iou

1049449660937515008.text: 7/ Tokenized Student Loans is an application built by @html5cat that allows students to easily create student loans and verify their identity on Ethereum. The app also has a Dharma relayer for users to invest in student loans, check it out!https://bit.ly/2RwGZoO

1049449511821631488.text: 6/ Dharma 0x relayer is an exchange that allows users to create a loan on @DharmaProtocol and then exchange it using @0xProject We’re really excited to see developers making use of ERC721 trading as enabled by 0x V2. Great stuff @hagaetc and @mewwts!https://bit.ly/2CxhnUu

1049449348637945863.text: 5/ Primotif is a platform built by @carlcortright @tbtstl and team that allows users anywhere in the world to get exposure to any assets. Primotif helps address the inability for people in developing countries to get exposure to the largest indices:https://bit.ly/2Ob0xRy

1049448726673018881.text: 4/ Planck is a decentralized application for short-selling ETH and ERC20 tokens built by @boredGenius and @skrishnan99. Planck always retains custody of the loaned funds, so creditors don’t have to worry about default risk, check it out!https://bit.ly/2NwspdP
